tool.name: MVORFFIP
tool.help:
General Information ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ VORFFIP is a tool for protein binding side prediction. Users have to provide the coordinates of the protein to use the server. Galaxy provides a user friendly way to do this.
Inputs ^^^^^^ The user must provide a file in the `pdb format <http://www.rcsb.org/>`__ representing the structure of a protein. Only the coordinates section of the pdb file is mandatory. If several chains are submited in the same file, VORFFIP will analyse the protein complex as a single protein, i.e. the residue properties will be calculated considering all chains as a single one.
Outputs ^^^^^^^ MVORFFIP will produce eight output files. These files contain the predition of interfaces and binding sites for proteins, peptides, DNA and RNA in tab separated and PDB format respectively.
